title: last_story_wa_anata_e
body:
From "VNDB":[https://vndb.org/v4775]:

[i]"One winter day main character logs in to Hypersense Network's cyber shopping mall to buy new memory. It is the so-called “Cyber Akihabara”. As soon as he punts in his ID and starts walking on the main street, his protocol is hijacked and screen distorts with poisonous colors. This illusion feels like a real Akihabara even though the weight of mouse and just bought memory can be felt in hands. With a lightning strike electronic machine starts to act up, and protagonist finds himself dragged into a dream-like twilight world."[/i]
other_names: ラストストーリーはあなたへ。

title: matsuno_osomatsu
body:
Title character of [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i] and its spin-offs.

He is the eldest brother in a group of [[sextuplets]]. Despite being their leader, he often is very unreliable and bull-headed.

Though indistinguishable from his brothers in [i]Osomatsu-kun[/i], in [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i] he is associated with the color red and a distinctive [[grin]] on his face.

title: totoki_airi
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character from the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. She has brown eyes and short brown twintails. She also has considerable curves. Her Nickname is "Totokin".

She appears prone to feeling too warm, leading her to, among other things, strip down out of the blue, without regard for where she may be at the time. Other idols and the Producer try to make sure she keeps her clothes on.

Due to her popularity, she was selected as 2012's Cinderella Girl from a general election held in the game. Following earning that title, she was selected for the third CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Kohinata Miho]], [[Tada Riina]], [[Honda Mio]] and [[Kawashima Mizuki]]. Her seiyuu is [[Harada Hitomi]].

* Age: 18
* Height: 161 cm
* Weight: 46 kg
* Birthday: December 8
* Blood type: O
* Three sizes: 88-58-88
* Hobbies: Baking cakes
* Writing Hand: Right
* Horoscope: Sagittarius
* Hometown: Akita

title: rainbow_cake
body:
A normally multilayered [[cake]], usually around 6 layers, with each layer being a separate color to create a rainbow when put together.  This is most commonly done by using food dye in the batter for each cake layer, but some cakes instead use different colored frostings to distinguish the layers.

Not to be confused with the Italian-American rainbow cookie, a 3-layer sponge cake cookie that traditionally features the colors green, white and red after the Italian flag.

title: kuben_blisk
body:
"Oi. This fight is what you were born for."

A known war criminal of the Frontier, Kuben Blisk operates the mercenary group known as the Apex Predators, a group commonly employed by the IMC. He displays a passive outlook on war: so long as he gets his pay, he doesn't care what side he's fighting on.

He also is the organizer of the Apex Games in [[Apex Legends]], appearing in game's initial launch trailer and several other supplementary materials including in-game loading screens, comics, and [[Rampart (apex legends)|]] and [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]]'s Stories from the Outlands shorts.

title: cybermen
body: A recurring antagonistic faction in [[Doctor Who]]. The Cybermen are a race of cyborgs who seek to assimilate all other sapient life into their ranks, and are notable for their distinctive, clanking cybersuits. While their nature may be familiar, they predate the [[Borg]].

title: stereogram
body: A stereogram is an optical illusion of depth created from flat, two-dimensional image or images. Originally, stereogram referred to a pair of stereo images which could be viewed using stereoscope or by crossing one's eyes and focussing on the resultant phantom image that appears between the two real ones. Other types of stereograms include [[anaglyph]]s and autostereograms.

title: charisma_establishment
body:
The opposite of [[charisma break]]. When a character suddenly turns very stoic / charismatic / cool from a less formal state.

h4. Guidelines 

* No meta-knowledge about the character should be required to enjoy the humour.
* The change must be dramatic, not subtle. 
* The change must occur within the same image as consequential event (expression charts or similar images do not count).

h4. See also

* [[charisma break]]

title: holy_sword_(sailor_moon)
body: Also known as the [b]Sword of the Silver Crystal[/b], it is a sacred sword of the Moon Kingdom meant for protecting [[Princess Serenity]]. Only [[Sailor Venus]] uses it for this purpose, although [[Sailor Moon]] is sometimes seen wielding it.

title: key_chain_(sailor_moon)
body: A chain that [[Sailor Pluto]] wears around her waist, which holds numerous [[key]]s. The [[Space-Time Key (sailor moon)|]] that [[Chibi Usa]] uses to travel to the past is one such key from this chain.

title: space-time_key_(sailor_moon)
body: A small [[key]] that [[Chibi Usa]] uses to travel back in time from the 30th century to the 20th century. It originally belongs to [[Sailor Pluto]], and is part of her [[Key Chain (sailor moon)|]].

title: stallion_reve
body: An object which only existed in the 90s anime version of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. A small orb that [[Chibi Usa]] uses to secretly communicate with a miniature version of [[Pegasus (sailor moon)|]].

title: nac_stein
body:
[b]Nac Stein[/b] (ナック・シュタイン) is a character in [[Akuma Shitsuji to Kuroi Neko]]. He resides in the Third Floor Rooms alongside [[Lucas Thompscie]] and [[Lamli Bennett]].

h4. Profile

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Gender:[/td]
[td]Male[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Age:[/td]
[td]26[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Height:[/td]
[td]176cm[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Weight:[/td]
[td]59kg[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Voice Actor:[/td]
[td]Kazuki Ura[/td]
[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Eye Color:[/td]
[td] [[heterochromia|Purple, Blue]] [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hair Color:[/td]
[td] [[green_hair|Green]] [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Management:[/td]
[td]Sweeping and Clean-Ups, Accountant, Negotiation Assistant[/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. Quote

[table]
[thead]
[th]Original[/th]
[th]Translation[/th]
[/thead]
[body]
[tr]
[td]「未来はどうせ予想できません。 それなら不安になる必要もありませんよね？」
[/td]
[td]"One is never able to anticipate the future anyway. If that's the case, is it truly right to say that one's insecurities are relevant?"
[/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. PV Info
Nac is firm, fastidious, and factitious. He likes beautiful things, and is very aware of what makes his mannerisms and speech patterns beautiful to others. A pretentious remark from him stands out.

[/tr]

[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. Quote

[table]
[thead]
[th]Original[/th]
[th]Translation[/th]
[/thead]
[body]
[tr]
[td]「ひとしきり泣いたら、 笑ってください。 笑顔は心を元気にしてくれますよ。」
[/td]

[/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. PV Info
Lucas seems aloof and unreliable, but he’s got a good head on his shoulders. He always holds an air of gentle ambience, but that’s not to say he doesn’t possess a cold, realistic side as well.

Fennesz is the Second Floor butler who’s in charge of bathing assistance. He often and kindly gives high praise to those in his surroundings. He always gets apprehensive when Haures overworks himself.

title: piyo_piyo_(phrase)
body: An onomatopoetic Japanese phrase piyo piyo suru {ピヨピヨする} which means to make a chirping or cheeping sound. A sound you would normally expect from a chickidee. It is roughly translatable to the "spring of adolescence", where people are carefree and happy-go-lucky. The most familiar use of this phrase is the [[piyo_piyo_apron]] worn by [[Otonashi_Kyouko]], one of the main characters from [[Maison_Ikkoku]]. It is believed by fans of the series to symbolize some kind of immaturity or refusal to move on in life.

title: scho-ka-kola
body:
A German brand of bitter-sweet dark chocolate known for its strong caffeine and kola nut mix, thus its name: [b]Scho[/b]kolade (chocolate), [b]Ka[/b]ffee (coffee), [b]Kola[/b]nuss (kola nut). The chocolate is divided into wedges held in a round metal canister. The red and white container design and recipe has changed very little since the original launch in 1936.

It was introduced at the 1936 Summer Olympic Games in Berlin as a performance-enhancing energy "Sport Chocolate" ([i]Sportschokolade[/i]).

During [[World War II]], it was also known as "Aviator Chocolate" ([i]Fliegerschokolade[/i]) since it was commonly provided with [[Luftwaffe]] pilot and crew rations, and was also issued to flight crews in blue canisters as emergency sea-survival rations ([i]Seenotpackung[/i]). It was also issued to German tank crews, U-boat crews, and the German Army.

Today, it is sold in Germany in both its original dark chocolate in a red-and-white container as well as a milk chocolate version in a blue-and-white container.

(Note that the term [i]Fliegerschokolade[/i] and its land-based equivalent, [i]Panzerschokolade[/i], were [i]also[/i] widely used by German soldiers and airmen as sarcastic euphemisms for Pervitin brand methamphetamine tablets, which were readily available and heavily used in the German armed forces in the early years of the war.)

See also: "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scho-Ka-Kola

title: okazaki_ritsuko
body:
Singer-songwriter (December 29, 1959 - May 5, 2004) famous and beloved for her work on anime music.

She performed the opening and ending themes for [[Fruits Basket]], [[Princess Tutu]] and [[Sukitte Ii Na Yo.]], and wrote "A Happy Life" for [[Gakuen Utopia Manabi Straight!]]. She was also involved in composing music for various series like [[Mahou no Princess Minky Momo]], [[Ai Tenshi Densetsu Wedding Peach]], [[Love Hina]], and [[UFO Princess Valkyrie]]. Her work on [[Symphonic Rain]] was released posthumously.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ritsuko Okazaki":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritsuko_Okazaki

title: the_refreshing_trio:_alola_idols
body:
[i]The Refreshing Trio: Alola Idols[/i] (サンサン3人はアローラドリンキュン, "W-W-We Three Are Alola DrinKyun"), also known as [i]Thrist-Three[/i] (サンドリ, "SanDri"), is show within a show in the [i][[Pokemon SM (anime)|Pokémon Sun and Moon]][/i] anime. It is a [[magical girl]] series aired by Alola TV and is a reference to [i][[PreCure]][/i] and [i][[Ai Tenshi Densetsu Wedding Peach]][/i], the latter, like the [i][[Pokemon (anime)|Pokémon]][/i] anime, was animated by OLM.

[i]Alola Idols[/i] is featured in episode 113, where the kids visit the Alola TV studios and the girls fill in for the lead actresses when the stars are unable to arrive to the studio in time.

The Alola Idols, unnamed in the English dub, are:
* Tea DrinKyun (ティードリンキュン) ([[Mallow (pokemon)|]])
* Soda DrinKyun (ソーダドリンキュン) ([[Lillie (pokemon)|]])
* Juice DrinKyun (ジュースドリンキュン) ([[Lana (pokemon)|]])

h4. See also

* post #3448139: Transformation sequence.

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: SM113":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/SM113]
other_names: サンサン3人はアローラドリンキュン
アローラドリンキュン

title: jack_mouton
body:
[b]Jack Mouton[/b] (ジャック・ムートン) is a character in [[Visual Prison]]. He is a member of the [[vampire]] unit called LOS† EDEN alongside [[Saga Latour]], [[Mist Flaive]], and [[Veuve Elizabeth]]. He is the twin brother of [[Robin Laffite]].

h4. Profile

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Gender:[/td]
[td]Male[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Height:[/td]
[td]155cm[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Birthday:[/td]
[td]October 22[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Eye Color:[/td]
[td] [[red_eyes|Red]] [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hair Color:[/td]
[td] [[black_hair|Black]] [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Color:[/td]
[td]Envy Green[/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. Description

Jack loves to play pranks and has a devilish temperament that he never hides. He seems childish much and likes to tease others, he likes having attention. He usually helps Veuve Elizabeth's clothing brand "Rougeurian" and is also its image model. His favorite things are sweets and games.

When Jack is jealous, he'll take an extra step to get rid of what he's jealous of or at least satisfy himself by doing what he thinks is best to be better than the person/thing that is better than him.

title: robin_laffite
body:
[b]Robin Laffite[/b] (ロビン・ラフィット) is a character in [[Visual Prison]]. He is a member of the [[vampire]] unit called O★Z alongside [[Ange Yuki]], [[Eve Louise]], and [[Guiltia Brion]]. He is the twin brother of [[Jack Mouton]].

h4. Profile

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Gender:[/td]

[/tr]

[td]Height:[/td]
[td]177cm[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Birthday:[/td]
[td]October 22[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Eye Color:[/td]
[td] [[red_eyes|Red]] [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hair Color:[/td]
[td] [[blonde_hair|Blonde]] [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Color:[/td]
[td]Innocent Yellow[/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. Description

Robin is renowned vocalist. As a child, he was called the voice of an angel and has been active in the classical music world. He is a free-spirited genius. He is innocent and easy to get along with, but he is also possessive. He is sensitive to trends and loves sweet things.

title: eve_louise
body:
[b]Eve Louise[/b] (イヴ・ルイーズ) is a character in [[Visual Prison]]. He is a member of the [[vampire]] unit called O★Z alongside [[Ange Yuki]], [[Guiltia Brion]], and [[Robin Laffite]].

h4. Description

Eve is a good friend and housemate of Gil. He is kind-hearted, reserved, and gentle. Gil takes good care of him, but because he keeps his distance from the world, he is not familiar with the latest trends and can appear to be a natural. He likes the coffee Gil makes.

body:

title: ange_yuki
body:
[b]Ange Yuki[/b] (結希アンジュ) is a character in [[Visual Prison]]. He is a member of the [[vampire]] unit called O★Z alongside [[Guiltia Brion]], [[Eve Louise]], and [[Robin Laffite]].

h4. Profile

[table]
[body]

[/tr]

[td]March 31[/td]
[/tr]

[td] [[heterochromia|Eye Colors:]] [/td]
[td] [[grey_eyes|Grey]], [[red_eyes|Red]]  [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Color:[/td]
[td]Fatal Orange[/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

h4. Description

Ange is clumsy but strong-hearted boy. Unable to adjust to his hometown, he comes to Tokyo to live in Harajuku. He has loved music since he was a child, and admires the songs of Gil from the first ECLIPSE. In order to get to the bottom of things, he unconsciously goes into people's pockets.

title: vesves_(sailor_moon)
body:
The red-haired character from the manga and anime [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. Known as the Magician of Beasts of the Dead Moon Circus, and former antagonist of the Inner Sailor Senshi.

During the series she a part of the Amazon Quartet and fourth youngest sister (in the anime she is the second-oldest). Later in the manga she is revealed to be [[Sailor Vesta]] who protects [[Chibi Usa]].

Voiced by Hagimori Junko in the 1990s anime, and [[Takahashi Rie]] in Crystal.

title: pallapalla_(sailor_moon)
body:
The blue-haired character from the manga and anime [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. Known as the Magician of Balancing Balls of the Dead Moon Circus, and former antagonist of the Inner Sailor Senshi.

During the series she is a part of the Amazon Quartet and second eldest (anime the youngest) of the four sisters. Later in the manga she is revealed to be [[Sailor Pallas]] who protects [[Chibi Usa]].

Voiced by Toyoshima Machiko in the 1990s anime, and [[Morohoshi Sumire]] in Crystal.

title: chari-bre_(meme)
body:
A Pixiv [[meme]] started on April 08, 2011.

[[Imizu (nitro unknown)|]] drew a pic of [[Remilia Scarlet]] trying to [[ahegao]] (post #892003). Other artists jumped on the bandwagon and the whole thing somehow became known as "karibure" (charisma break). Not to be confused with the "Charisma Break":[/pools/1083] pool.

title: if_you_draw_heart-shaped_pupils_this_will_become_a_nsfw_image_(meme)
body:
A Twitter [[meme]] inspired by a tweet by [[Fukai Ryosuke]].

Original tweet (now deleted):

[quote]
かわいい女の子絵の瞳にハートを描きこんだら「それは成人向けの表現なので控えて」というチェックが返って来たがソレは先入観ではないのかーーっっ！

I added [[heart-shaped_pupils|hearts in cute girl's pupils]] in my art and received a correction request: "You're better off without that because it represents NSFW art." [i]BUT ISN'T THAT PREJUDICE!?[/i]
[/quote]

[[Shikio Satoru]]'s "response":https://twitter.com/str_dorobou/status/647273106017382401

[quote]
ここはタグを作るべきではないだろうか #瞳にハートを描きこむと成人向けの絵になる

It's time to create a Twitter hashtag, isn't it? #If-You-Draw-Hearts-in-the Pupils-This-Will-Become-a-NSFW-Image
[/quote]

* "Twitter: 瞳にハートを描きこむと成人向けの絵になる":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/%E7%9E%B3%E3%81%AB%E3%83%8F%E3%83%BC%E3%83%88%E3%82%92%E6%8F%8F%E3%81%8D%E3%81%93%E3%82%80%E3%81%A8%E6%88%90%E4%BA%BA%E5%90%91%E3%81%91%E3%81%AE%E7%B5%B5%E3%81%AB%E3%81%AA%E3%82%8B]

title: ruger_super_redhawk
body: A double-action revolver line introduced by Sturm, Ruger and Company in 1987. The Super Redhawk is a large, heavily built revolver, usually long-barreled and visually identifiable by its distinctive frame, which extends for some distance along the barrel in front of the cylinder to support an integrated mounting system for a telescopic sight. Originally available only in .44 Magnum, it has since been offered in other large-bore cartridges, such as .454 Casull and .480 Ruger, as well as 10mm Auto. It is only made in stainless steel.

title: patria_pasi
body:
The Patria Pasi (earlier known as the Sisu Pasi) is a Finnish-made six-wheeled [[armored personnel carrier]] (APC) originally designed for Finnish Defence Forces.

The basic appearance and configuration of Patria Pasi is similar to most wheeled APCs. The XA-180 and XA-185 versions are fully amphibious while the XA-203 is not.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Patria Pasi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patria_Pasi]

title: aim-120_amraam
body:
Advanced Medium-Range Air-to-Air [[Missile]], or AMRAAM (pronounced AM-ram), is an American beyond-visual-range air-to-air [[missile]] (BVRAAM) capable of all-weather day-and-night operations.

Designed with a 7-inch (180 mm) diameter, and employing active transmit-receive radar guidance instead of semi-active receive-only radar guidance, it has the advantage of being a fire-and-forget weapon when compared to the previous generation [[aim-7_sparrow|Aim-7 Sparrow]] missile. 

When an AMRAAM [[missile]] is launched, NATO pilots use the brevity code Fox Three.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: AIM-120 AMRAAM":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AIM-120_AMRAAM]

body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

title: shuumatsu_no_harem
body:
A 2016 manga serialized in [b]Shounen Jump+[/b], it is written by [b]LINK[/b] with art by [[Shouno Kotarou]]. The series centers on a boy who wakes up five years after a virus has killed most of the men on Earth, and the government's efforts to get him to directly reproduce with a harem of girls. There is an anime adaptation that was released during the Winter 2022 season by [i]Studio Gokumi[/i] & [i]AXsiZ[/i].

English Title: World's End Harem

h4. Characters

title: cure_felice
body:
[[Mahou Girls Precure!]] character. [[Magical girl]] identity of [[Hanami Kotoha]], also known as [[ha-chan (mahou girls precure!)|Ha-chan]].

Her only alternate form is her [[cure felice (alexandrite style)|Alexandrite Style]]. She does not have a Ruby, Sapphire or Topaz Style.

[i]Felice[/i] is an Italian word meaning [i]happy[/i] or [i]lucky[/i].

title: cure_summer_(excellen-tropical_style)
body: [[Cure Summer]] in her Excellen-Tropical Style. Her [[high ponytail]] is [[very long hair|much longer]], her [[crop top]] gains a [[white capelet]], and her skirt has [[layered skirt|multiple layers]]. She [[barefoot|doesn't wear any footwear]], but has [[white ribbon|white]] [[leg ribbon]]s.
other_names: エクセレン・トロピカルスタイルサマー

title: cure_la_mer_(excellen-tropical_style)
body: [[Cure La Mer]] in her Excellen-Tropical Style. Her [[double bun]]s are exaggerated and the white pearls are replaced with blue ones. She wears a halterneck blouse and a form-fitting [[blue skirt]] that looks like a [[mermaid]]'s tail. She [[barefoot|doesn't wear any footwear]], and wears pearl anklets.
other_names: エクセレン・トロピカルスタイルラメール

title: cure_pine
body: The Pretty Cure alter ego of [[Yamabuki Inori]] in [[Fresh Precure!]], also known as the Cure of Prayers. Her outfit color is yellow and her suit symbol is the diamond. Her upgraded form is [[cure pine (angel)|Cure Pine Angel]].

title: cure_peach
body: The Pretty Cure alter ego of [[Momozono Love]], also known as the Cure of Love, and is the leader of the [[fresh precure!|Fresh Precure]] team. Her theme color is pink and her suit symbol is the heart. Her upgraded form is [[cure peach (angel)|Cure Peach Angel]].

title: cure_berry
body: The Pretty Cure alter ego of [[Aono Miki]] in [[Fresh Precure!]], also known as the Cure of Hope. Her theme color is blue and her suit symbol is the spade. Not to be confused with [[Cure Beat]], who bears a striking physical resemblance to Cure Berry. Her upgraded form is [[cure berry (angel)|Cure Berry Angel]].

title: cure_berry_(angel)
body: [[Cure Berry]] in her Angel form. While most of her outfit doesn't change, she gains a pair of blue mechanical-looking wings. Her wings have become the butt of several jokes due to how different and un-angelic they look compared to the other Cures' wings.

title: cure_passion_(angel)
body: [[Cure Passion]] in her Angel form. Most of her outfit stays the same, but her pantyhose become [[thighhighs]] and she gains a pair of [[white wings|white]] [[angel wings]].
other_names: エンジェルパッション

title: cure_peach_(angel)
body: [[Cure Peach]] in her Angel form. Her outfit undergoes some changes, her kneehighs become [[thighhighs]], and she gains a pair of [[white wings|white]] [[angel wings]].

title: cure_pine_(angel)
body: [[Cure Pine]] in her Angel form. Most of her outfit doesn't change, but she gains a pair of [[yellow wings|yellow]] [[angel wings]].

title: cure_moonlight
body: The Pretty Cure alter ego of [[Tsukikage Yuri]] in [[Heartcatch Precure!]], who used to work as a Cure before [[Cure Blossom]], [[Cure Marine]] and [[Cure Sunshine]]'s tenure, so Cure Moonlight has more experience. She is significantly stronger than the other three Cures, but initially lacks the power and resolve to fight as a team with them due to some tragic circumstances. Her upgraded form is [[cure moonlight (super silhouette)|Cure Moonlight Super Silhouette]].

title: cure_sunshine
body: The Pretty Cure alter-ego of [[Myoudouin Itsuki]] in [[Heartcatch Precure!]]. She uses light-themed defense barriers shaped in sunflowers, plus similar light-related attacks. Her upgraded form is [[cure sunshine (super silhouette)|Cure Sunshine Super Silhouette]].

title: cure_marine
body: The Pretty Cure alter-ego of [[Kurumi Erika]]. Although [[heartcatch_precure!|Heartcatch Precure]]'s main theme is flowers, her power seems to revolve around the sea. She often works with [[Cure Blossom]] as partners. Her upgraded form is [[cure marine (super silhouette)|Cure Marine Super Silhouette]].

title: cure_blossom
body: The Pretty Cure alter-ego of [[Hanasaki Tsubomi]], and the first Cure to appear in [[heartcatch precure!|Heartcatch Precure]]. She had trouble understanding her powers, but gradually adapted to them. Often works as [[Cure Marine]]'s partner, but can usually handle herself in a fight. Her upgraded form is [[cure blossom (super silhouette)|Cure Blossom Super Silhouette]].

title: rinoa_heartilly
body:
Rinoa Heartilly is a female protagonist and playable character from [[Final Fantasy VIII]]. She is best known for her trademark [[angel wings]] printed on the back of her [[sleeveless duster]] sweater and, as such, her "character symbol" is a white feather that signifies the wings. She is [[Squall Leonhart]]'s love interest, and is featured in the game's logo with him. 

She has medium-length [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her outfit consists of [[arm warmers]], a blue [[sleeveless]] [[open clothes|open]]  [[coat]], [[bike shorts]], [[denim skirt]], and a black [[undershirt]]. She also has a [[black ribbon]] on her left forearm.

[spoiler]A witch (sorceress, abroad).[/spoiler]
other_names: リノア・ハーティリー

title: commissar
body:
Power sword, mini-rocket-firing pistol and a big cool hat. Et voila, you have just got yourself one of the most badass normal humans ever to exist in the whole grimdark nightmare that is [[Warhammer 40k]].

Imperial Guardsmen are tough and loyal to the Imperium, but a good [b][s]BLAM[/s][/b] encouragement from a Commissar will ensure the troopers' morale always remains at one thousand percent. That pretty much sums up the job of an average Commissar: making sure that the men (and women) hold the line at all cost. These cool-hat zealots are also very quick to be on the triggers at the slightest notions of cowardice, Chaos taint or even donning your uniforms the wrong way; but their presence on the battlefield is nonetheless much appreciated due to their aforementioned role. After all, aren't they the ones that ensure us puny humans actually stand our ground against all kind of Eldritch abominations that the universe throws at us and even [i]duke it out[/i]?

• [[Astra Militarum]]

title: lasgun
body:
[i]We bring the light of the Immortal God Emperor to the furthest parts of the Galaxy[/i]

[b]Lasgun[/b] or otherwise known as [b]Lasrifle[/b] is one of the two inseparable items (with the other being the [s]T-shirt[/s] ceramite vest) of the trillions of Imperial Guardsmen out there fighting for the Imperium Of Man. While the weapon lacks the stopping power comparing to the Bolter or T'au Railgun, its ease of production, the lack of ammunition requirement, and most important of all, the sheer amount of Imperial Guardsmen will more or less make up for the Lasgun shortcoming.

After all, nothing beats unleashing an ocean of metal-melting laser bolts in the face of your opponent.

•[[Astra Militarum]]
